Straight Shot nods in agreement. 

" Couldn't agree with you more, Talon.  =
It's just a matter of getting him past that stubborn streak of his.  And yo=
u got my permission ta kick him in his tires when he continues acting like =
a stubborn tractor trailer truck."

Tucson turns in Straight Shot's directi=
on.  

" All right, since you put it that way, I'll take your advice.  But =
if something comes about, call me.  Now, we have a meeting to complete."

H=
e turns to the door. 

" And what the pit is taking Rodimus so long!?"

Per=
petually on the move and constantly busy.

> Tucson nods in agreement. 
>  
> " Very well Leo Prime.  Qu=
ickstride will head the construction of the wind and hydro turbines.  Anyon=
e who wishes to be on that team, report to Quickstride for instruction.   A=
s for Cheetor, I'm afraid he has yet to be found.  Nightshift and Rattrap d=
id all they could to search for him, and I do believe Nightshift is severel=
y damaged and will need immediate repairs."
>  
> He narrows his eyes.
>  
=
> "As for the mysterious enemy controlling the dinosaurs, I will venture ou=
t to that location and I will show him what happens when you toil with some=
thing  that you have no business toiling with.  I just can't sit here and e=
xpect all of you to risk your lives out there..."
>  
> There is a bit of a=
 pause as Tucson tries to fend off a wave of weakness due to not taking amp=
le time in the CR chamber.
> He takes a deep breath and composes himself on=
ce again.
> Quickstride looks to Tucson with concern as does Straight Shot.=

>  
> " Wait a minute, Sir, no offense but you don't look like you're in t=
he condition to do anything too strenuous.  In fact there's still a really =
big dent in that arm of yours."
>  
> Straight Shot nods.
>  
> "He's right=
 Tucson, you really need ta slow down.  You took a pit of a beating from Hy=
dras and anyone in your state, should seriously take care of  themselves."
=
>  
> Tucson gives a gentle smile.
>  
> " I'll be fine, I assure you.  I'v=
e been through worse."
>  
> Straight Shot sits up and looks to Leo Prime.
=
>  
> "He's not listening to me.  Maybe he'll listen to you.  He's already =
taken more of his share of hard hits and if he thinks he's gonna go out the=
re and do it all again, he's flipped a microchip or two. "
>  
> Tucson dir=
ects his attention over to Straight Shot.
>  
> " I know, I know, you have =
every right to not approve of my actions, but I failed this faction once, I=
 will not fail it again."
>  
> Straight Shot swallows hard as a tear trick=
les down her right eye.
>  
> " No, what happened back then wasn't your fau=
lt.  None of it was.  Leo he's blaming himself for what happened to Rodimus=
 and the others on himself.  He thinks that if he had just been a little mo=
re careful, he could've prevented Hydras from winning that battle.  But it =
wasn't his fault.  I was in his cab with him as an on board scout, looking =
out for possible ambush.  I saw someone in the skies far off behind us and =
I froze because he moved in really fast.  By the time Cyclonus moved in for=
 the shot, I could barely say anything.  I was terrified.  Then that's when=
 it happened.  I don't remember too much after that but he was not the bot =
who failed the faction, I was.  And there isn't a day that goes by without =
me being reminded of that costly error I made out on that battle field."
> =
 
> Tucson moves over to his sister and puts a hand on her shoulder.
>  
> =
" No, that was never your fault.  It was mine.  I should have never asked y=
ou toventure out with me on such a dangerous mission."
>  
> He then looks =
to everyone.
>  
> " Times are about to get difficult.  In order to win the=
 battle ahead we have to work together, and we need to remain strong.  We w=
ill overcome as we have for centuries.  Freedom is the right for all sentie=
nt beings.  Now let us win it, for this planet, for us and for Primus."
>

<div>Tucson nod=

<div>" Very well Leo Prime.&=

wind and hydro turbine=

nstruction.   As for Cheetor, I'm afraid he has yet 
to be found.=
  Nightshift and Rattrap did all they could to search for him, 
and I =
do believe Nightshift is severely damaged and will need immediate 
repairs.=
"</div>
<div> </div>
<div>He narrows his eyes.</div>
<div> </div>=

<div>"As for the mysterious enemy controlling the dinosaurs, I will ventur=
e out 
to that location and I will show him what happens when you toil with=
 something 
that you have no business toiling with.  I just can't sit =
here and expect 
all of you to risk your lives out there..."</div>

sp;</div>
<div>There is a bit of a pause as Tucson tries to fend off a wave=

due to not taking ample time in the CR chamber.</div>

 takes a deep breath and composes himself once again.</div>

e looks to Tucson with concern as does Straight Shot.</div>
<div> </di=
v>

condition to do anything too strenuous.  In fact there's still a =

dent in that arm of yours."</div>

ht Shot nods.</div>

themselves."</div>

p;</div>

'll be fine, I assure you.  I've been through worse."</div>

;</div>

<div>&nbsp=
;</div>

sp; He's 
already taken more of his share of hard hits and if he thinks he'=
s gonna go out 
there and do it all again, he's flipped a microchip or two.=
 "</div>
<div> </div>
<div>Tucson directs his attention over to Straig=
ht Shot.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>" I know, I know, you have every righ=
t to not approve of my actions, but I 
failed this faction once, I will not=
 fail it again."</div>
<div> </div>
<div>Straight Shot swallows hard a=
s a tear trickles down her right eye.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>" No, wh=
at happened back then wasn't your fault.  None of it 
was.  Leo h=
e's blaming himself for what happened to Rodimus and the others 
on himself=
.  He thinks that if he had just been a little more careful, he 
could=
've prevented Hydras from winning that battle.  But it wasn't his 
fau=
lt.  I was in his cab with him as an on board scout, looking out for 
=
possible ambush.  I saw someone in the skies far off behind us and I f=
roze 
because he moved in really fast.  By the time Cyclonus moved in =
for the 
shot, I could barely say anything.  I was terrified.  Th=
en that's when 
it happened.  I don't remember too much after that but=
 he was not the bot 
who failed the faction, I was.  And there isn't a=
 day that goes by without 
me being reminded of that costly error I made ou=
t on that battle field."</div>
<div> </div>
<div>Tucson moves over to =
his sister and puts a hand on her shoulder.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>" =
No, that was never your fault.  It was mine.  I should have 
neve=
r asked you toventure out with me on such a dangerous mission."</div>
<div>=
 </div>
<div>He then looks to everyone.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>"=
 Times are about to get difficult.  In order to win the battle ahead 
=
we have to work together, and we need to remain strong.  We will overc=
ome 
as we have for centuries.  Freedom is the right for all sentient =

beings.  Now let us win it, for this planet, for us and for Primus."<=
